item.title: S&P 500 Drops to Start New Quarter
item.description: Fresh data raise doubts on whether the Fed will cut rates three times this year. The S&P 500 fell 0.2% and the Dow industrials shed 0.6% after both finished last week at records.

item.title: Trump Media Shares Tumble After Recent Cash Crunch Disclosed
item.description: The stock’s plunge erased more than $1 billion from Donald Trump’s approximately 57% stake in the company.

item.title: Beat High Mortgage Rates With an Intrafamily Loan. Here's How the Taxes Work.
item.description: We answer a reader’s question about lending money to a granddaughter for a down payment on a home.

item.title: Baltimore Bridge Collapse Could Fuel Reinsurance Pricing
item.description: The cost of insuring against extreme risks has been rising, and the complexity of covering Baltimore’s tragedy may further that.

item.title: This Disney War Has Already Paid Off
item.description: The stock price has jumped after many shareholder-friendly changes—without adding rancor to the company’s board.

item.title: Don't Count Samsung Out in the AI Memory Stakes
item.description: Chip makers SK Hynix and Micron have gained, but Samsung’s financial and tech capacity are ready to shine.

item.title: Inside the Russian Shadow Trade for Weapons Parts, Fueled by Crypto
item.description: How Russian middlemen used the cryptocurrency tether to avoid U.S. sanctions and procure parts for drones and high-tech weapons.

item.title: The Stock Market's Magnificent Seven Is Now the Fab Four
item.description: Some investors say it is a bullish signal that the market is rallying without the likes of Apple and Tesla because it means other groups are taking part.

item.title: How to Negotiate With a Real-Estate Agent
item.description: A legal settlement that stands to do away with longstanding commission rules is rewriting the playbook for home buyers.

item.title: The Climate Scientist Fossil-Fuel Companies Can't Stand
item.description: Robert Howarth’s research on natural gas exports influenced the White House and exasperated oil and gas executives.

item.title: How High-Yield CDs Turn Into 0.05% CDs While You're Not Looking
item.description: Customers have sought out certificates of deposits for higher rates, but sometimes banks roll maturing CDs into new ones with lower rates.

item.title: Wealth Management Is a Risky Gold Rush for Banks
item.description: Catering to the rich offers high returns and room for growth, but it is not for every big lender.

item.title: No Showers, No Sleep: Van Life Isn't as Cool as Instagram Makes It Seem
item.description: With home prices so high, living on wheels seems a reasonable alternative. Many find it isn’t.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
item.description: Read about our columnists’ favorite and least-favorite stocks and see how they have performed.

item.title: Agricultural Giant Syngenta Scraps $9 Billion Listing in China
item.description: IPO approvals in mainland China have been largely on hold since last August.

item.title: Tesla's Terrible Quarter Catches Some Analysts Asleep at the Wheel
item.description: Whatever delivery number the electric-vehicle maker reports for January through March, it will be well below the ‘consensus’ on your terminal screen.

item.title: Giant Merger Deals Stage a Comeback
item.description: A flurry of tie-ups, led by Capital One, raises the prospect of an M&A rebound.

item.title: Gold Is Rallying. It Isn't About Inflation This Time.
item.description: The metal serves as a hedge against fear itself, making it an appealing asset for our times.

item.title: How a 'Gorgeous' Dior Bag Cost a Widow $61,000 in Tax Court
item.description: Many spouses automatically sign joint tax returns without realizing they are on the hook for their partner’s tax cheating.

item.title: The Psychologist Who Turned the Investing World on Its Head
item.description: Daniel Kahneman gave people an understanding of what drives financial decisions.
